name: Basic Profile for Coding
description: Basic Profile for Coding for validation support

definition.short: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system
definition.formal: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
definition.comments: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the v3 core principles for more information.

constraint.name: Value set doesn't substitute for system
constraint.human: If a valueSet is provided, a system URI SHALL also be provided.

mapping.map: CE/CNE/CWE subset one of the sets of component 1-3 or 4-6

definition.formal: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.
definition.comments: The identity is a uri. It may be an OID or a UUID, which SHALL be references to the HL7 OID registry, or a URI which either comes from HL7's list of FHIR defined special URIs or from some system defined elsewhere, in which case the URI should de-reference to establish the system unambiguously.

definition.short: Version of the system - if relevant
definition.formal: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured. and when it is not, the version SHOULD be exchanged.

definition.short: Symbol in syntax defined by the system
definition.formal: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).
A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules laid out by the system.

mapping.map: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

definition.short: If this code was chosen directly by the user
definition.formal: Indicates that this code was chosen by a user directly - i.e. off a pick list of available codes.
definition.comments: Amongst a set of alternatives, a directly chosen coding is the most appropriate starting point for new translations.

definition.short: Set this coding was chosen from
definition.formal: The set of possible coded values this coding was chosen from or constrained by.
